intro: Nesaea pubescens, commonly known as the hairy nesaea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Nesaea pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
